28 AWESOME Content Marketing Tools

Written by Brian Dean

Last updated on May. 15, 2025

I’ve built my entire business around great content and awesome SEO, so I’d like to think I know a thing or two about content marketing tools that move the needle.

In fact, I’ve used many of the tools on this list to grow my site’s traffic to 500k+ visits per month (and growing).

These tools cover the full spectrum of content marketing needs — from keyword research and SEO, to design, analytics, and heatmap tracking tools.

What’s common about all the tools on this list is that they can help you get a lot more mileage from your content marketing program. When used in tandem, expect more traffic, engagement, and conversion from your content.

You can’t go wrong with any of the recommendations here.

Let’s take a closer look at each, shall we?

28 Best Content Marketing Tools

1. Semrush

The all-in-one tool that serves as the foundation of your content marketing program

Semrush is such a powerful tool that it’s hard to describe all its capabilities inside a few paragraphs.

When I’m unsure of what keywords or topics to target, I start by examining my competitors’ sites and the keywords they rank for inside Semrush.

Semrush also gives me a precise understanding of where I stand with regard to the competition — by showing me topics where my content program falls short. This gives me an actionable list to start creating content immediately.

As stated above, Semrush is the literal foundation on top of which my content marketing program rests. I use Semrush for keyword research and other things like backlink analysis and traffic audits.

After I’ve identified the keywords I want to target, I use its SEO content template to build briefs for my writers.

Before uploading to my content management system, I like to put each draft through the SEO writing assistant for final checks. And I’m able to gauge whether the strategy is working via Semrush’s position tracking tool — which monitors keyword movement across the SERPs.

Pricing: $125/month and above

My Favorite Feature: The keyword gap tool

This tells me where my content strategy lacks and what I need to do to catch up. Within minutes, I can rethink my content approach toward generating relevant and rank-worthy output.

The Bottom Line

Without Semrush, you’re not going to be able to scale your content marketing program effectively. It’s simply the best all-in-one tool for all things content marketing.

2. AI Apps from the Semrush App Center

Scale content production, including videos

AI Apps often operate either in silos, or out of context. Adding, the workflows are new, and you won’t always know what to even look for in an AI tool.

Semrush has been changing this fast. The suite of AI tools for content creation has been getting more and more impressive. Some of the tools I’ve tried follow.

AI Social Content Generator

The standard for content quality on social media has been growing just like what we’re seeing in SEO content. Social, though, is known for requiring higher quantity and frequency.

If you want to produce with both quantity and quality, and publish enough videos, you’ll be excited to find out that you can now do so at scale.

AI Writing Assistant

This app has brought scale to the writing steps that might have slowed you down. Ideas, consistency in voice and tone, plagiarism, or just writing help throughout the process. Compared to Jasper and other known AI writing apps, this one is great for SEO content in particular.

ContentShake AI

Subject matter expertise has been growing in importance through Google’s algorithm updates. Also, through poor use of AI tools, you now need to write based on expertise even more in order to stand out.

This app helps with that a whole lot. You may have your own expertise, you may have access to experts you can interview. Either way, adding the relevant knowledge that AI auto-populates for you can be huge for how good your content turns out.

AI Video Marketing Automator

YouTube is likely the best platform for you as a content creator that you don’t own. In other words, once you’ve grown your blog on your own website, one of the next best focus areas is YouTube.

If you already have great content and you want to repurpose it, you’ll save a ton of time if you can do so automatically.

This AI video app converts blog posts into videos. Then it helps you edit them. Then it also helps you translate them. Imagine the bandwidth needed for doing all that without AI.

AdCreative.ai

Semrush’s AdCreative.ai emerges as a powerful ally for marketers.

This AI-powered tool is a game-changer for creating high-converting visual and text content across various platforms.

It’s like having a top-tier creative team at your fingertips, churning out attention-grabbing headlines, eye-catching visuals, and complete content packages tailored to your brand.

By streamlining your entire content creation process in one app, AdCreative.ai frees you up to focus on what really matters—getting results.

Pricing: Starting from $24 per month

My favorite features:

  • Text-to-video in the AI Social Content Generator
  • Target keywords for SEO writing in the AI Writing Assistant
  • Adding facts, stats, or images in ContentShake AI
  • Auto-generated AI voice-over in AI Video Marketing Automator
  • Generating eye-catching visuals and attention-grabbing headlines in AdCreative.ai

The Bottom Line

To empower yourself and your team, and to scale the content creation steps that were not possible to scale before, you’ll want to give these apps a serious try, and embed your favorites into your workflows.

Your content program is also going to benefit from the fact that the apps are a part of the top SEO tool.

3. QuestionDB

Find and answer your audience’s burning questions.

Let’s face it:

Coming up with blog post topic ideas is HARD.

That’s why I’m PUMPED whenever I come across a tool that makes this process easier.

And QuestionDB is exactly that: a simple tool that helps you quickly come up with dozens of blog post ideas.

To use it, enter a topic that you want to write about. And QuestionDB will scour the web for questions that people are asking about that topic.

Pricing: Free or $10/month

My Favorite Feature: “Sort By”

By default, QuestionDB sorts questions by popularity (in other words: how often that question gets asked). That’s helpful for sure.

But sometimes you want to get a high-level overview of what people want to know about a topic. Fortunately, you can sort by “Topic”. This organizes the results into different categories.

The Bottom Line

QuestionDB has quickly become one of my favorite ways to find new blog post and YouTube video topic ideas. If your site focuses on question-based keywords, the $10 per month plan is totally worth it.

4. BuzzSumo

Advanced content marketing tool for pros.

From topic research to brand monitoring, BuzzSumo is an all-in-one content marketing toolkit that’s packed with features:

It’s like a giant content marketing Swiss Army Knife.

That’s not to say that BuzzSumo is confusing or hard to use. It’s more than the features (and price point) geared toward professional SEOs and content marketers.

Learn everything you need to know about BuzzSumo and how best to apply it to your content marketing campaigns, with lots of pro tips.

Pricing: $79-$499 per month

My Favorite Feature: “Content Research”

I’ve had a BuzzSumo account since 2014. Back then, Content Research was their only feature. And despite adding dozens of features since then, it’s the one I still use most often to help me with content creation.

That’s because it makes finding proven content topic ideas fast and easy.

The Bottom Line

If you’re serious about SEO and content marketing, I highly recommend giving BuzzSumo a shot.

5. Mixkit

Hundreds of free HD stock videos.

Want an awesome clip to feature in your latest YouTube or Facebook video?

Thanks to Mixkit, there’s no need to hire a camera crew. You can get access to about 100 HD videos for free.

The best part? According to the website, they’re adding about 10 new videos to the site every week.

Pricing: Free

My Favorite Feature: “Categories”

This is just like it sounds: a collection of videos organized into different categories. This makes it easy to find the video you want.

The Bottom Line

When I first heard about Mixkit, I was skeptical that the videos would be any good. But after watching about 20 of them I can confirm that they’re all LEGIT high-quality stuff.

6. TopicRanker

Identify easy-to-rank keywords for quick SEO wins.

How do you climb up the SERPs quickly, without spending a ton of time in keyword research and link building?

TopicRanker takes away the guesswork from keyword research by providing an in-depth list of easier-to-rank search terms, sorted by things like:

  • Thin or outdated content
  • Title tag mismatch
  • Poor readability scores

All I have to do is enter my website URL and a broad topic I’m interested in ranking for.

TopicRanker scans the domain to understand its niche and gives me a report approximately 15 minutes later.

Inside the report, there’s an actionable list of keywords highly relevant to my niche sorted by ranking difficulty.

I’m able to dive in for a closer look and understand what parts of the existing search results are under-optimized, and how to build better content.

TopicRanker is a literal cheat code to reach new audiences and get quick traffic wins.

Pricing: $47 – $103 per month.

My Favorite Feature: “Suggest Seed Topics”

This feature is available on TopicRanker & a game-changer. If I’m ever stuck trying to unlock new keyword ideas, the app does the heavy lifting by suggesting new topics relevant to my business.

The Bottom line

TopicRanker is gradually carving out its niche in the content marketing space, and I can tell it’s going to be a new tool in the arsenal of many SEOs. I’m looking forward to seeing what additional features they add to their app.

Bonus Tip: If you’re a Semrush user, check out their SERP Gap Analyzer tool.

It analyzes your website’s topical relevance, scans thousands of SERPs, and uses proprietary variables to determine ranking difficulty. This can save you hours of manual research and help you find low-hanging fruit for quicker SEO wins.

7. SquidVision

Zero in on content marketing assets that drive conversions and revenue.

Analytics tools will tell you how much traffic a blog post generates, but it’s much harder to equate each post with actual revenue numbers.

SquidVision is a unique new tool that offers granular insights into what aspect of your landing pages and blog posts result in new customers.

It works similarly to a heatmap tool, generating snapshots of your blog posts and tracking clicks on the page.

But what makes it stand out from others is that it attributes each heatmap to verified sign ups and payments.

This means I can literally see how much revenue every blog post has generated, and repeat the structure for my best-performing ones.

SquidVision helps me identify underperforming CTAs or aspects where users drop off. That’s conversion gold — with a few tweaks I can get an immediate boost to my content marketing program.

Pricing: $49-$199 per month

My Favorite Feature: “Revenue Bubbles”

Hover over any revenue bubble on a heatmap and it will generate a bigger revenue bubble with a breakdown of clicks, trial sign-ups, and revenue for that button or link.

The Bottom line

SquidVision is an exciting new entry into the content marketing/landing page optimization space. I don’t know why it took this long to get revenue attribution on heatmaps, but I’m glad it’s finally here.

Note: As of writing this SqiudVision only integrates with Stripe users and Shopify users.

8. CoSchedule’s Headline Analyzer

Improve your blog post and article headlines.

It’s no secret that your headline is SUPER important.

But how do you know if your post’s headline is actually good… before you publish it?

The Headline Analyzer.

CoSchedule Headline Analyzer scores your headline based on a bunch of different factors (like length and sentiment).

Helpful.

Pricing: Free

My Favorite Feature: Suggestions

Unlike most other headline analyzers I’ve tried, the CoSchedule tool gives you tons of actionable recommendations that you can use to make your headline even better.

The Bottom Line

The next time you’re about to publish a post (or send out a newsletter), run your title through this tool first.

9. SimilarWeb

Get analytics on your competitors’ websites.

Want to know how much traffic your competitors get every month? Or the keywords that they rank for in Google?

Then you’ll love SimilarWeb.

SimilarWeb gives you insider data on your competitor’s top pages, keywords and traffic sources.

Pricing: Free or Enterprise pricing

My Favorite Feature: “Referrals”

See the exact sites that send your competitor the most traffic.

The Bottom Line

I love SimilarWeb. My only gripe is that they don’t offer a straightforward monthly plan (only “Enterprise”). I’d happily pay $200 per month to get access to more data. But I don’t want to deal with the hassle of the enterprise sales process.

10. ShareThis

High-quality social sharing buttons.

I’m a big fan of putting prominent social sharing buttons on your site. In my experience, it’s an easy way to get more shares on Twitter, Facebook and other social media websites.

The issue is that most social buttons look ugly.

Not ShareThis.

ShareThis has sharp-looking social buttons that you can easily customize to match the look and feel of your website.

Pricing: Free

My Favorite Feature: ShareThis WordPress plugin

This makes it easy to get social buttons on your WordPress blog.

The Bottom Line

If you want an easy way to get social sharing buttons next to your blog content, look no further than ShareThis.

11. Buffer

Schedule Facebook, Twitter and Instagram posts.

Buffer is a super simple way to make sure your social media posts go out when your audience is actually around to see them.

Just write a tweet just like you normally would. Then, schedule it to go out later.

Simple.

Pricing: $15-$199 per month

My Favorite Feature: Analytics

See which Tweets got the most attention (in terms of clicks, retweets and overall engagement).

The Bottom Line

I’ve been a Buffer customer for over 6 years. That’s because their tool is easy to use and reliable.

12. Canva

Visual content. Simplified.

You probably already know that visual content is growing fast.

That’s good news. The bad news is that creating visual content is TOUGH.

You either need to work with a professional graphic designer. Or learn how to use fancy image editing tools.

Or do you?

Well, Canva makes the process of creating visual content much more accessible.

In fact, you can start creating anything from Instagram posts to presentations in a matter of seconds. And Canva’s intuitive drag and drop interface makes it surprisingly easy to get the look and feel that you want.

Pricing: $12.95 per month

My Favorite Feature: “Templates”

These are beautiful, pre-packaged image templates for popular social networks.

The Bottom Line

I’ve tried tons of online image editing tools, and Canva is one of the best… especially when it comes to creating images for social media.

13. Content Idea Generator

Find content ideas in seconds with this cool little tool from Portent. It generates dozens of different blog post titles.

For example, if you want to write something about the Paleo Diet, you’d enter “Paleo” into the tool. And it will spit out a title suggestion:

If that title isn’t what you were looking for, click the arrow to get another one. Rinse and repeat until you find an idea you like.

Pricing: Free

My Favorite Feature: Tooltips

This tool doesn’t just spit out suggestions. It also outlines why the different pieces of that particular headline work.

The Bottom Line

A fun tool to help you blast through writer’s block.

14. Followerwonk

Find influential Twitter users.

Followerwonk makes it easy to find influencers on Twitter.

Just search for the type of influencer you want to connect with (for example “search engine optimization” or “Crossfit”), and this tool will generate a list of highly-connected people in that space.

Pricing: $29-$79 per month

My Favorite Feature: Social Authority

Most tools sort Twitter users by the number of followers. Which is helpful.

But Followerwonk goes deeper. Instead of sheer follower counts, it shows you users that are followed by OTHER highly-followed peeps.

The Bottom Line

If you want to get started with influencer marketing, Followerwonk isn’t a bad place to start.

15. Aweber

Super simple email marketing.

Aweber was one of the first fully-automated Email Service Providers.

And in my opinion, 20 years later, it’s still one of the best. That’s why I send newsletters to 177,310 email subscribers using Aweber’s platform:

If you want a thousand features and advanced segmentation, you’re probably better off with something like ConvertKit.

But for a simple email newsletter or content promotion campaigns, Aweber is great.

Pricing: $19-$149/month (up to 25k subscribers)

My Favorite Feature: Segments

Aweber added their version of marketing automation to the platform. Like with the main product, it’s simple to use. And after using it on two product launches I can confirm that it works really well.

The Bottom Line

If you want a simple email marketing platform with great deliverability, I recommend checking out Aweber.

16. Hemingway Editor

Software that makes your writing better.

Hemingway is like having a writing coach review your work.

Specifically, it lets you know if your copy uses the passive voice… or has sentences that are hard to read.

Pricing: Free or $19.99 one-time payment for desktop version

My Favorite Feature: Similar Phrases

Hemingway lets you know if your content uses fancy words (like “Utilize”). And offers simpler suggestions.

The Bottom Line

Hemingway is an easy way to evaluate your writing before you hit “Publish”.

17. Alltop

Top headlines from various news sources in one place.

Alltop isn’t a traditional content marketing tool. It’s more of an interactive list of popular blogs in about 50 different niches (including Food, Photography and SEO).

What can you do with this information?

Well, you can use Alltop to find blogs to guest post on. Or you can see what topics bloggers in your industry all talking about. The possibilities are pretty much endless.

Pricing: Free

My Favorite Feature: Viral

An easy way to find content that’s getting crazy amounts of shares at any given time. Perfect for newsjacking.

The Bottom Line

Alltop is one of my favorite free content marketing tools.

18. SocialBlade

Spy on your competitor’s YouTube channels.

SocialBlade is like getting an inside look at a competitor’s YouTube Studio account.

Sure, SocialBlade shows you stuff that you can see anywhere (like real-time subscriber count). But what makes this tool special is that it collects a channel’s stats over time.

That way, you can see the exact number of subscribers and views someone gets every month (and how that changed compared to last month).

Pricing: Free

My Favorite Feature: YouTube Progress Graphs

Get a visual of how much a channel has grown over the last year.

The Bottom Line

SocialBlade is a simple tool for figuring out which channels in your industry are growing (or tanking). That way, you can model what’s working right now.

19. Clearscope

A more modern way to optimize your content.

If you’ve ever used an “SEO grader”, you’ve walked away disappointed.

After all, you probably already know that you should “use your keyword in your title tag”.

Well, Clearscope takes SEO content graders into the modern age. Specifically, it gives you a list of specific keywords that you should use in your post.

Pricing: $300 per month

My Favorite Feature: “Content Grade”

Copy and paste your draft into Clearscope… and see which words and phrases you’re missing…

The Bottom Line

Clearscope isn’t cheap. But if SEO is the main focus of your content marketing, it’s probably worth trying out.

20. Airstory

Cite research and data with ease.

Airstory pivoted from a full-fledged content writing platform to a Chrome and Firefox extension that helps you cite sources in your content.

For example, let’s say you have a Google Doc or Evernote file called “social media stats”. And it’s a list of stats that you’ve collected over the years.

Well, with Airstory, you don’t need to open that document 100 times just to copy and paste the same stat.

Instead, you can store the stat in Airstory as a “Note”… and one-click paste it into your content.

Pricing: Free

Favorite Feature: Tags

Use tags to sort notes into different categories (like “content curation” or “blogging stats”)

The Bottom Line

If you write a lot of highly-sourced, data-driven content, Airstory will quickly become one of your favorite content marketing tools.

21. Wordable

Publish WordPress posts directly from Google Docs.

Do you write most of your blog posts in Google Docs?

If so, then you know that porting that content over to WordPress is a giant pain.

Enter: Wordable.

Wordable pushes your Google Doc into your WordPress site… with the push of a button. It’s a massive time saver.

Pricing: $19 per month

My Favorite Feature: Post or Page

You can choose to publish your Google Doc content as a WordPress post or page. Not a huge deal, but a nice little feature for those of you that prefer to publish content as a page instead of a post.

The Bottom Line

If you’re tired of copying and pasting content into WordPress, check out Wordable.

22. Exploding Topics

Find emerging content topics for blog posts, YouTube videos, and more.

Finding blog posts topics is easy.

But finding topics that haven’t been covered to death already?

That’s a different story.

Well, that’s where the new Exploding Topics come in.

This tool scans the web for topics (including brands) that are growing in popularity. And they curate the best of the bunch.

Pricing: Free

My Favorite Feature: Categories

This filter lets you find trending topics on categories that you care about, including fashion, lifestyle, eco and home.

The Bottom Line

If you want to find topics (and SEO keywords) that are popular but not competitive yet, I recommend checking out this free tool.

23. TubeBuddy

Easily optimize your YouTube videos.

TubeBuddy is a feature-rich tool designed to help you grow your YouTube channel.

That said, TubeBuddy’s focus is definitely video SEO.

In fact, most of its core features focus on things like tags and rank tracking.

Pricing: $9-$49 per month

My Favorite Feature: “Retention Analyzer”

This is a dashboard of your channel’s Audience Retention numbers. That way, you can see which videos keep your audience engaged… so you can make more of them.

The Bottom Line

If you’re looking for an easier way to optimize your videos, give TubeBuddy a shot.

24. HotJar

See how people interact with your content.

HotJar combines heatmaps with a bunch of other helpful features to help you visualize how users actually use your website.

That way, you can tweak your content marketing strategy to give people what they actually want.

Pricing: $29-$589 per month.

My Favorite Feature: “Recordings”

We actually used this for a beta product we were testing. And the insights we got from user recordings were absolutely mind-blowing.

The Bottom Line

There are a lot of heatmap tools out there. But in my experience, HotJar is the best of the bunch.

25. Loomly

A simple editorial calendar.

Loomly is super simple editorial calendar software. Even though you can use Loomly to plan any type of content, its focus is definitely on social media posts.

Pricing: $20-228 per month

My Favorite Feature: “Workflow”

Workflow is like a mini content assembly line within Loomly. That way, your marketing teams can collaborate on the content that you publish.

The Bottom Line

Great tool for organizing and scheduling social media posts.

26. Frame.io

Make video content better with collaboration.

Back in the day, I used to HATE sending feedback to my video editor.

I’d have to timestamp every single change and send screenshots.

Then, one day, my editor said he wanted to try something called Frame. And it was a GAME CHANGER.

Today, I just leave a comment on the exact spot that needs a change. And it gets done.

Amazing.

Pricing: $0-$25/user per month

My Favorite Feature: “Notifications”

Get a list of all uploads, comments and changes since you last signed in.

The Bottom Line

If you work with a video editor (or a team), there’s no need to email edits and Drobox links back and forth. Frame is 100x more efficient.

27. Kraken

Crunch your images and improve website loading speed.

Kraken is an easy and effective way to reduce the file size of your images… without sacrificing quality.

In fact, we use Kraken at Backlinko and it’s made a huge dent in our pagespeed.

Pricing: $5-$79 per month

My Favorite Feature: Kraken WordPress Plugin

Automatically crunches any images that you upload to your WordPress media file.

The Bottom Line

There are a million image optimizer tools out there. And I’ve tried them all. In my experience, Kraken is the best.

28. Google Analytics

Track your content marketing campaigns for free.

Google Analytics is a must-have tool for any content marketer.

Why?

Because it tells you pretty much everything you need to know about your content marketing campaigns, including traffic sources, landing pages, user engagement metrics and more.

That way, you can tweak your content strategy… or double down on what’s already working for you.

Pricing: Free

My Favorite Feature: Referrals

This report shows you which sites (outside of the usual suspects like Google and Facebook) are sending you the most traffic.

The Bottom Line

If you’re not using Google Analytics, you’re missing out on a treasure trove of data.

Bonus #1: Mailshake

Email outreach made easy.

If you want to promote your content with outreach you can probably do just fine with a simple Gmail account. But if you want to scale outreach? That’s where a tool like Mailshake comes into play.

It has a ton of features (like campaigns, templates and team collaboration) to help you send personalized outreach emails at scale.

Pricing: $29-$49 per month

My Favorite Feature: “Extensions”

Integrate Mailshake with about a dozen APIs, including Google Forms and MailChimp.

The Bottom Line

Mailshake is a simple yet powerful outreach tool.

Bonus #2: Snappa

Make awesome-looking social media images in a snap.

Need an easy way to create custom visuals… without Photoshop?

Snappa is for you.

With Snappa you can grab one of their templates and customize it to fit the look and feel of your brand. Nice.

Pricing: $10-$20 per month

My Favorite Feature: Template Graphics Sizes

Work with images that already have the correct image sizes for Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn… even Soundcloud.

The Bottom Line

Snappa is a great tool for creating social media images without needing graphic design skills.

Bonus #3: Influencer Analytics

Ever feel like finding the right influencers is like searching for a needle in a social media haystack? Enter Semrush’s Influencer Analytics — your new secret weapon for influencer marketing.

Influencer Analytics is a powerful tool for discovering and evaluating influencers across YouTube, Twitch, Instagram, and TikTok.

Simply input your niche or industry, and Influencer Analytics will generate a list of relevant content creators along with detailed performance metrics.

Pricing: Starts at $169 per month

My Favorite Feature: Cross-Platform Competitor Analysis

Influencer Analytics allows you to compare influencer campaigns across ALL major social media platforms. It’s like having X-ray vision for your industry’s influencer landscape.

The Bottom Line

If you’re serious about influencer marketing and want data-driven insights to guide your strategy, Influencer Analytics is a robust solution that covers all major social platforms.
